alert.note: Alert for Cabell; Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Cabell, southwestern Putnam and north central Lincoln Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Culloden, or 9 miles north of Hamlin, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Hurricane, Milton, Culloden and Teays Valley. This includes Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 26 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
